metadata.dc:author: Rodríguez-Caravaca, Gil
Gil-de-Miguel, Angel
Villar-del-Campo, María Concepción
Casas-Losada, María Luisa
Cava-Valenciano, Fernando
metadata.dc:description: INTRODUCTION Study of an outbreak of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection. METHODS Case-control study. Odds ratios for various risk factors were studied in patients with acute hepatitis C and an appropriate control group. RESULTS Seven cases and 46 controls were included. Implantation of a central catheter was found to be an independent risk factor for hepatitis C (OR=35; 95% CI: 16.0-62.0). CONCLUSION Inadequate manipulation of central catheters with heparinized saline solution, which was likely to be HCV-contaminated, caused the outbreak.
metadata.dc:title: Brote de hepatitis C en una unidad de oncología.
[Hepatitis C outbreak in an oncology ward].
